alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Pike; Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 3:03PM EDT until July 09 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lackawanna, Pike and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sterling, Hawley, Lehigh, Arlington, Ledgerdale, Lake Ariel, Tresslarville, Greentown, Angels, Mount Cobb, Gouldsboro, South Canaan, Newfoundland, Lakeville, Quicktown, Drinker, Cortez and La Anna. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
